description: {"blocks":[{"key":"21iiu","text":"This is a protocol for the preparation of a sample of alpha-synuclein fibrils on a PLL-coated cover glass for TAB-PAINT imaging with Nile Red. This protocol was used to generate the data shown in Figure 3 of the following publication:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":196,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3jtcq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8t89u","text":"Bruggeman et al., POLCAM: Instant molecular orientation microscopy for the life sciences. bioRxiv 2023.02.07.527479 (Feb 2023), doi: https://doi.org/10.1101/2023.02.07.527479","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":10,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":97,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":121,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":133,"length":41}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"3734C9D6AEFB11EEAB870A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://doi.org/10.1101/2023.02.07.527479"}}}}
manuscript_citation: {"blocks":[{"key":"ed7ie","text":"POLCAM: Instant molecular orientation microscopy for the life sciences\nEzra Bruggeman, Oumeng Zhang, Lisa-Maria Needham, Markus Körbel, Sam Daly, Matthew Cheetham, Ruby Peters, Tingting Wu, Andrey S. Klymchenko, Simon J. Davis, Ewa K. Paluch, David Klenerman, Matthew D. Lew, Kevin O’Holleran, Steven F. Lee. bioRxiv 2023.02.07.527479, doi: https://doi.org/10.1101/2023.02.07.527479","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":309,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":341,"length":41}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"0DEF049EAF1911EE982D0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://doi.org/10.1101/2023.02.07.527479"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9n6e9","text":"Prepare alpha-synuclein fibrils by diluting alpha-synuclein monomer   in PBS (with 0.01% NaN3) and incubating at   in a shaker (200 rpm) for over  . You can store the fibrils at   for later use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":92,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":68,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":113,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":146,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":178,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"diqll","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"70","error_concentration":false,"guid":"31D3F6AEAF1411EE85BF0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":29}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"70","error_concentration":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"31D3F74EAF1411EE85BF0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"70","duration":86400,"error_concentration":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"31D3F7E7AF1411EE85BF0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"3":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5vtvr","text":"Argon plasma clean cover glass (VWR collection, 631-0124) for   in a plasma cleaner (Expanded Plasma Cleaner, PDC-002, Harrick Plasma).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":62,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"511813BAAF1411EE85BF0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7kcm0","text":"In the meantime:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fnp2f","text":"Filter phosphate-buffered saline (PBS) using a 0.02 μm syringe filter (6809-1102, Whatman).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bqe5g","text":"Dilute Nile Red in filtered PBS to a concentration of  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":54,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8ho8v","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fat5t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"1","error_concentration":false,"guid":"5BDE2EF9AF1411EE85BF0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":30}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c7tab","text":"If you purchase Nile Red in solid form, we recommend preparing a 1 mM solution of Nile Red in DMSO and freezing small aliquots for later use. For each experiment, always use a new aliquot of Nile Red to prepare the 1 nM dilution, as the dye doesn't store well at low concentrations.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4m9ar","text":"Create a PLL-coated sample well on the cover glass:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4onhb","text":"Use a pipet to remove the excess PBS from the well, add   of alpha-synuclein fibrils and pipet up and down a few times in each corner of the sample well and wait for  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":56,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":166,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a5ik8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"80ij3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":5,"offset":63,"style":"italic"}],"key":"d4chi","text":"A 1:2 dilution of the fibrils is usually a good starting point, i.e. a 35 mM equivalent monomer concentration.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dt2k5","text":"Create a sample well on the cleaned cover glass by sticking a frame-seal slide chamber (9x9 mm, SLF0201, Bio-rad) on the glass.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ar7j0","text":"Pipet   of 0.01% PLL (0.01% poly-L-lysine solution, P4707, Sigma-Aldrich) into the well and wait for  . The PLL will coat the surface of the cover glass.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":6,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":101,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fjgg9","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1l0vq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"70","error":false,"guid":"8154804EAF1411EE85BF0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"70","duration":900,"error":false,"guid":"815480A6AF1411EE85BF0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"atk87","text":"Always use a freshly thawed aliquot of PLL. You can aliquot the PLL and store it in a -80 °C freezer.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d4pmk","text":"Use a pipet to remove the excess PLL from the well and immediately replace it with   of filtered PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":83,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"70","blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fsivm","text":"It is important to always have liquid on top of the PLL-coated glass. We have found that if the PLL dries out during any stage of the sample preparation or imaging, this will cause a lot of fluorescent background in the sample that looks very similar to the fluorescence signal from single molecules.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"error":false,"guid":"8CC119DFAF1411EE85BF0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"avr31","text":"Use a pipet to remove the excess filtered PBS from the well and replace with  filtered PBS. Gently pipet up and down in the corners of the well. Repeat this step 2 more times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":76,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"70","error":false,"guid":"5ED9D37AAEF811EEAB870A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2is6m","text":"Remove the excess PBS from the well using a pipet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ml20","text":"Using a pipet, add   of 0.1 µm diameter TetraSpeck Microspheres (0.1 µm, fluorescent blue/green/orange/dark red, T7279, Invitrogen) into the well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":19,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8r0vt","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"377uq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"9BC61DE7AF1411EE85BF0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"28ndf","text":"The concentration of TetraSpeck Microspheres (0.1 µm, fluorescent blue/green/orange/dark red, T7279, Invitrogen) will vary between batches from the vendor. You will likely need to test out a few dilutions to find the concentration that results in the right amount of microspheres per field of view.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c19nj","text":"Gently pipet up and down a few times and wait for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":50,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6sto0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"15g4g","text":"Use a pipet to remove the excess solution from the well and replace with  filtered PBS. Gently pipet up and down in the corners of the well. Repeat this step 2 more times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":72,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"70","error":false,"guid":"5ED9D37AAEF811EEAB870A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1f8c5","text":"Remove excess solution using a pipet and add   of filtered PBS to the well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":45,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fp25u","text":"Remove excess solution again and replace by   of   Nile Red.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":44,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":49,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"1","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":30}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fp14k","text":"Image the sample straight away and make sure it doesn't dry out during imaging.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: TAB-PAINT imaging of alpha-synuclein fibrils using Nile Red
